title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7695.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7695.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

As used in this Part, the following definitions shall apply
to the terms listed below: (a) Unlawful discrimination shall mean acts or policies which adversely affect
individuals based on race, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disabling condition(s) or political belief, except as provided by
law. (b) A disabled individual
shall mean one who has a physical or mental limitation which substantially
limits one or more of such person's major life activities. Such disability
shall be based upon a medically documented record of impairment and such person
shall be regarded as having a disability. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9

7695.2

New

York State Register April 11, 2018/Volume XL, Issue 15, eff. 4/11/2018

comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
